be_updated: Keep up to date with all the news from the 2024 Conference
Special_Guests_Paragraph: At the 2024 edition of the European Youth and Family Conference we will have as special guests Pastor Luigi Mițoi, whom we have already met at other editions, and Pastor Nelu Filip, president of the Pentecostal Church in Romania.
Theme_paragraph:
This year's topic will be ENGAGEMENT.
 We will have presentations devoted to this very topical and important subject for young people.
We want every young person, regardless of age, to be actively and positively involved in God's work in the local church.
We will also have prayer meetings where young people can benefit from the infusion of the Holy Spirit for full involvement in the ministry of the church.
Location_paragraph: As in previous years, the European Conference will be held at the “BELLA ITALIA EFA VILLAGE” in Lignano Sabbiadoro (UD), Italy.
Conference_date_paragraph:
The European Conference will be held from 1 to 3 NOVEMBER 2024.
We look forward to welcoming you and spending memorable moments together!
Previous_editions_paragraph: Interested in seeing how previous editions went? Click on the images to watch the live videos of previous editions.
general_questions_paragraph: If you have questions, you can find the answers here. If your question is not answered write to us!
isSignupRequiredAnswer: Yes. Your personal data will have to be entered at the hotel reception, along with the participant's contact details for future information about the event. If you are unable to register online, you can ask the church group registrar to do it for you.
isOnlineSignupEnough: Is online registration sufficient or is there more to do?
isOnlineSignupEnoughAnswer: Online registration is the first step and helps us to already reserve the necessary places and to know in real time the number of participants and the closing time for registration. The second step of registration is to register with the church's designated group leader or youth leader in the church. Registration is done by paying the full amount, at which time the room allocation is also made.
whoCreatesRooms: Who is in charge of the reservation and room assignment?
whoCreatesRoomsAnswer: The group leader of your church will allocate rooms. If a room is not full, it will be filled with participants from other groups according to age and gender criteria. Ideally, participants should already be paired with their friends and fill a room on their own at the time of registration.
whenIstheInscriptionConsideredSafeAnswar: After paying the group leader in full and assigning the room. Please note: Online registration on the Conference website is only the first step. Without payment of the registration fee and room assignment by the group leader, registration is not considered complete.
whenIsTheInscriptionDeadline: Until when is it possible to register?
whenIsTheInscriptionDeadlineAnsware: The deadline is 27 October, but registrations can end even earlier if the available places are exhausted. We have around 3,000 reserved places and once they are sold out, no more registrations will be accepted. This is why online registration helps us to know exactly how many participants there will be and when the registration list will close.
ChurchNotInList: If my church is not in the list of churches in the Conference link, what should I do?
ChurchNotInListAnswer: Registration takes place at church level through the responsible person appointed by the church leadership or youth leader. If there are other participants from your church, you can ask for your church to be listed in the Conference directory by sending a message to +39 380 639 7797. If you are the only participant from your church, you can join the list of the nearest church, where you can pay the participation fee and book a room. If you do not have this option, you will be placed on a special list that uses the same phone number for communication.
singleDayParticipationQuestion: Can I sign up for a day?
singleDayParticipationAnswer: This is currently not possible. Registration is now only for full participation in the Conference sessions with full payment for the two days. Partial registrations will only be accepted if there are still places available after 28 October.
participateWithoutHousingAndMeal: Can I attend the conference without paying the fee for meals and accommodation?
participateWithoutHousingAndMealAnswer: Not yet. Places are limited and reserved for those who register and pay the full registration fee. Only a few days before the Conference will we know if there are still places available in the Conference hall. The hall has a maximum capacity of 3,000 seats and if these are occupied by those staying in the Complex, we will not be able to accept entry without a reservation. The status of registrations and availability of places will be regularly updated on the Conference website.
minimumAgeAnswer: We encourage the participation of young people and teenagers over the age of 14, but exceptions may be made if the group leader or family takes responsibility for supervision during the Conference or during the trip. The participation of minors in the Conference and their travel must be made on the basis of a power of attorney signed by the parents if the minor is not accompanied by parents. This power of attorney will be provided by and must be handed over to the group leader.
amountToPayForChildren: What is the participation fee for children?
amountToPayForChildrenAnswer: Children under 3 years of age are exempt from the participation fee. All those who have already reached the age of 3 will pay the full amount for the room type.
specialProgramforKids: Will there be special programmes for children?
specialProgramforKidsAnswer: If there are families with children, we will organise special programmes with them through the Sunday School Department during the Conference sessions.
reimbursementQuestion: Can I ask for a refund of the registration fee?
reimbursementAnswer: After 27 October, the closing date for registrations, no refunds can be made as food and accommodation bookings have already been made and registrations are considered final. Until 24 October, replacements may be made for those who withdraw for serious objective reasons analysed by the group leader.
onlinePaymentAnswer: Personal payment of the Conference fee must be made to the group leader at the church in the manner determined by the group leader. The group leader may, in turn, for the whole group, make the payment online as instructed by the organisers or at the reception desk on arrival of the group. Those who pay online in advance are requested to bring the receipt to the reception.
accomodationPricesParagraph:
Price per person for two days:

(Accommodation two nights, two breakfasts, two lunches, two dinners, access to the Conference Hall.)
1room: In a room with one bed - 170 Euro/person (very limited availability)
2room: In a room with two beds - 140 Euro/person
3room: In a room with 3/4 beds - 130 Euro/person
5room: In a room with 5/6 beds - 120 Euro/person
extraPricing: This year we will also offer, subject to availability, the possibility of accommodation in external hotels, 3 and 4-star category, both in the full board formula (accommodation + 3 meals per day) and in the accommodation + breakfast formula, in which case participants will organize themselves for lunch and dinner.
extraPricingOptionWithFood: In double or triple room - 200 euros/person, accommodation for two nights, two breakfasts, two lunches, two dinners + entry to the Conference Hall.
extraPricingOptionWithoutFood: In double or triple room - 120 euros/person - accommodation for two nights, two breakfasts + entry to the Conference Hall. Lunch and dinner are not included here.
extraPricingExtraInfo: These prices are indicative as we are still negotiating with external hotels and prices may vary slightly from one hotel to another. However, for Bella Italia Village, the prices are already set and confirmed.
cookiePolicyDefinitionDescription: This website uses technical cookies to ensure the proper functioning of procedures and to improve the user experience of online applications. This document provides information about the use of cookies and similar technologies, how they are used by the site, and how to manage them.
CookiesTypesDescription:
Based on the characteristics and use of cookies, different categories can be distinguished:

- Technical cookies. Technical cookies are those used solely for the purpose of 'transmitting a communication over an electronic communications network, or to the extent strictly necessary for the provider of an information society service explicitly requested by the subscriber or user to provide that service' (see Art. 122, paragraph 1, of the Code). They are not used for additional purposes and are normally installed directly by the website owner or manager. They can be divided into browsing or session cookies, which ensure normal navigation and use of the website; analytics cookies, considered equivalent to technical cookies when used directly by the site manager to collect information, in aggregate form, on the number of users and how they visit the site; functionality cookies, which allow the user to navigate according to a set of selected criteria in order to improve the service provided to them. For the installation of these cookies, the prior consent of users is not required, although there is still an obligation to provide information pursuant to Art. 13 of the Code, which the site manager, if only using such devices, may provide in the manner they deem most appropriate.

- Profiling cookies. Profiling cookies are aimed at creating profiles related to the user and are used to send advertising messages in line with the preferences expressed by the user while browsing the web. Due to the particular invasiveness that such devices may have within the private sphere of users, European and Italian regulations require that the user be adequately informed about their use and thus express their valid consent. They are referred to in Art. 122 of the Code, which provides that 'the storage of information in the terminal equipment of a contractor or a user or access to information already stored is permitted only on the condition that the contractor or user has given their consent after being informed in the simplified manner referred to in Article 13, paragraph 3' (Art. 122, paragraph 1, of the Code). This site does not use profiling cookies.
GADescription:
The site also includes components transmitted by Google Analytics, a web traffic analysis service provided by Google, Inc. ("Google"). These cookies are used solely for the purpose of monitoring and improving the site's performance. For more information, refer to the link below:

https://www.google.it/policies/privacy/partners/

The user can selectively disable Google Analytics by installing the opt-out component provided by Google in their browser. To disable Google Analytics, refer to the link below:

https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout
CookieDurationDescription: Some cookies (session cookies) remain active only until the browser is closed or the logout command is executed. Other cookies 'survive' the browser closure and are available for future user visits. These are called persistent cookies, and their duration is set by the server when they are created. In some cases, an expiration date is set, while in other cases, the duration is unlimited.
cookieManagementDescription:
The user can decide whether to accept cookies or not using their browser settings. Attention: disabling technical cookies, either partially or fully, may compromise the optimal use of the site.
 Disabling "third-party" cookies does not affect navigation in any way.
 The setting can be specifically defined for different websites and web applications. Additionally, browsers allow setting different preferences for "first-party" and "third-party" cookies. For example, in Firefox, through the Tools->Options->Privacy menu, you can access a control panel to define whether or not to accept different types of cookies and proceed to their removal. Documentation on how to set cookie management rules for your browser is easily available on the internet. As an example, here are some links to the main browsers:
privacyPolicyDescription: This page describes the methods of managing the site regarding the processing of personal data of users who visit it.
privacyPolicyDescription2: This is a notice provided in accordance with Article 13 of Legislative Decree 196/2003 ('Privacy Code') and Article 13 of Regulation EU 679/2016 ('GDPR Regulation') for those who interact with web services accessible online from the address:
privacyPolicyDescription3: The notice is provided only for the sites in question and not for other websites that users might consult through links.
privacyPolicyDescription4: The notice is also inspired by Recommendation No. 2/2001, which the European authorities for personal data protection, gathered in the Group established by Article 29 of Directive 95/46/EC, adopted on May 17, 2001, to identify some minimum requirements for collecting personal data online, including the methods, times, and nature of the information that data controllers must provide to users when they connect to web pages, regardless of the purposes of the connection.
dataControllerDescription: Following the consultation of this site, data relating to identified or identifiable persons may be processed.
dataControllerDescription2: The 'data controller' is Comunità Territoriale Pentecostale Italia, located at Via Bosche' 37, 31040 Mansue' (TV).
placeDataProcessingDescription: The processing related to the web services of this site takes place at Comunità Territoriale Pentecostale Italia and is managed only by technical staff of the Office responsible for processing, or by any appointed staff for occasional maintenance operations.
placeDataProcessingDescription2: No data derived from the web service is communicated or disclosed.
placeDataProcessingDescription3: The personal data provided by users who request the sending of informational material (newsletters, CDs, newsletters, annual reports, responses to inquiries, documents and measures, etc.) are used solely to perform the requested service or performance and are communicated to third parties only if necessary for that purpose.
navigationDataDescription: The IT systems and software procedures responsible for the functioning of this website acquire, during their normal operation, some personal data whose transmission is implicit in the use of Internet communication protocols.
navigationDataDescription2: These are information that is not collected to be associated with identified data subjects, but which by their nature could, through processing and associations with data held by third parties, allow for the identification of users. This category of data includes IP addresses or domain names of computers used by users connecting to the site, URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) addresses of the requested resources, request time, method used in submitting the request to the server, file size obtained in response, numerical code indicating the status of the response given by the server (success, error, etc.) and other parameters related to the user's operating system and IT environment.
navigationDataDescription3: These data are used solely to obtain anonymous statistical information on the use of the site and to check its proper functioning, and are deleted immediately after processing. The data could be used to ascertain responsibility in the event of hypothetical cybercrimes against the site: apart from this eventuality, web contact data do not persist for more than seven days.
dataProvidedByUser: Data provided voluntarily by the user
dataProvidedByUserDescription: The optional, explicit, and voluntary sending of emails to the addresses indicated on this site involves the subsequent acquisition of the sender's address, necessary to respond to requests, as well as any other personal data included in the message.
dataProvidedByUserDescription2: Specific summary information will progressively be reported or displayed on the site’s pages designated for particular services upon request.
optionalityOfProvidedDataDescription: Apart from what is specified for navigation data, the user is free to provide personal data listed in request forms or otherwise indicated in contacts to request the sending of informational material or other communications.
optionalityOfProvidedDataDescription2: Failure to provide such data may result in the inability to obtain the requested items.
optionalityOfProvidedDataDescription3: For completeness, it should be noted that in some cases (not part of the ordinary management of this site) the Authority may request information under Article 157 of Legislative Decree No. 196/2003, for the purpose of controlling the processing of personal data. In these cases, responding is mandatory under penalty of administrative sanction.
TreatmentModalityDescription: Personal data are processed using automated tools for the time strictly necessary to achieve the purposes for which they were collected.
TreatmentModalityDescription2: Specific security measures are observed to prevent data loss, unlawful or incorrect use, and unauthorized access.
InterestedRightsDescription: Data subjects have the right at any time to obtain confirmation of the existence or non-existence of their data and to know its content and origin, verify its accuracy, or request its integration or updating, or rectification (Article 7 of Legislative Decree No. 196/2003).
InterestedRightsDescription2: Under the same article, there is the right to request the deletion, anonymization, or blocking of data processed in violation of the law, as well as to object, for legitimate reasons, to its processing.
InterestedRightsDescription3: Requests should be addressed to the Data Controller.
